bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 220 (Monday, December 28, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SMITH of Washington:H.R. 9055.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8 Clause 1--``The Congress shall have power to lay and collect taxes,duties, imposts, and excises, to pay the debts and providefor the common defense and general welfare of the UnitedStates; but all duties, imposts and excises shall be uniformthroughout the United States''[Page H9166]

summary.text:
Crisis Housing Act of 2020

This bill provides funding to public housing agencies for rental assistance for certain families located in an area that either (1) meets specified unemployment levels, or (2) is subject to a major disaster declaration. The bill designates the funding as emergency spending, which is exempt from discretionary spending limits.

bill.title: Crisis Housing Act of 2020

item.title: To authorize the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to provide funding to public housing agencies for the purpose of providing tenant-based assistance to individuals experiencing an economic crisis or natural disaster, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
